comments.body:
**edit**: okay, just read your sentence of the PR. My bad!

---

AFAIK, `fireEvent()` is returning a Promise ([source](https://github.com/testing-library/vue-testing-library/blob/master/src/vue-testing-library.js#L102)), and here it appears to be returning a boolean 

disclaimer: I might be missing something basic, as I have no experience with type definitions ðŸ˜‡
Yeah, I'll get this updated to 2.0 after we get 1.2 published. (Or I could just do that now if we want to avoid another PRâ€”I don't feel that strongly about it.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +107,111 @@// Reexports event functions from dom-testing-library
// Note that it does NOT make the core fireEvent() function asynchronous
lib.fireEvent(elem, new Event('change')); // $ExpectType boolean
lib.createEvent.click(elem); // $ExpectType Event
lib.createEvent.click(elem, {foo: "bar"}); // $ExpectType Event
